function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate recovery capability in the event of a disruptive event such as a contagious disease outbreak","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of disciplinary-specific approaches to resilience, including in the context of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of organizational resilience may lead to decreased ability to absorb strain and adapt to adversity, increasing vulnerability to contagions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of social resilience may result in a community’s inability to cope with external stresses and disturbances, making it more susceptible to contagion spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of resilience dimensions may lead to incomplete mitigation strategies for contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of economic resilience may lead to neglect of economic factors in disease mitigation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited understanding of engineering resilience may result in inadequate infrastructure for disease response","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of how a system fails","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate resilience of infrastructure systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on interdependent network performance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consensus on resilience definitions leads to ambiguity in understanding resilience concepts.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasis on returning to steady state performance level in some definitions may hinder adaptive responses to new and emerging contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diverging views on the role of preparedness and recovery activities in resilience definitions may create inconsistencies in disease containment strategies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness for contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate recovery activities after a disease outbreak","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited resilience in infrastructure systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal distribution of resilience research across different domains may lead to neglect of certain areas of application, including contagious disease resilience.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on resilience in the engineering domain may result in inadequate preparedness for engineering-related contagious disease outbreaks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uneven distribution of resilience-related research across different years may indicate gaps in understanding the evolving nature of contagious disease threats and preparedness.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Qualitative assessment methods may overlook important numerical metrics that are crucial for understanding the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of domain-specific representation in quantitative resilience approaches may result in overlooking unique factors relevant to contagious disease propagation in different environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of qualitative aspects in quantitative resilience approaches may lead to overlooking the socio-behavioral factors that influence contagious disease spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of system drivers and disturbances","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate buffer capacity for change in the system","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of internal and external resilience policies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quantification of system resilience","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vulnerability to mass transportation system attacks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in achieving resilience in medication delivery","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of experience about resilience engineering","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Choosing production over safety","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of reporting system","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of semi-quantitative indices to assess resilience may lead to oversimplification of complex systems and miss important factors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on expert opinion for assessing resilience variables may introduce bias and inaccuracies in the assessment process.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The process industry may be vulnerable to contagious diseases due to the high density of workers and the potential for disease spread within the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unrealistic assumption of 100% quality of community infrastructure before earthquake","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inaccurate resilience measurement due to deterministic static metric","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"General applicability of the resilience triangle metric may lead to misapplication in different contexts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in comprehending the resilience metric","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Assumed instantaneous impact of disruptive events","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Linear recovery assumption may not be realistic for some systems and events","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Difficulty in estimating expected degraded performance level for unknown disruptions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to quantify resilience value within a range of 0 and 1 for dynamic resilience.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ambiguity in defining system states and their corresponding performance metrics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complexity of the time-dependent resilience metric equation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Ambiguity in notation and terminology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"The text contains multiple references to disruption, non-operability, and recovery, indicating a focus on the impact of contagious diseases on system resilience.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of specificity in accounting for recovery time in the formulation of resilience metrics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resilience metric that does not consider time to recover, leading to inaccurate assessment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate safety indicator measurement for public transportation systems’ resilience assessment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of mathematical equations without proper context","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"}]}
